    • Constructor Detail

      • Polynomial

        public Polynomial()
        Immediately creates a polynomial consisting of nothing. Allows for the other methods to be added and stacked on top of this one. Our first node will be set to null to indicate that it stores no value. Additionally, it's next is set to null through our Node class.

      • Polynomial

        public Polynomial(Integer coefficient,
                  Integer power)
        Constructs a polynomial with the given parameters. Creates a new node with the given parameters and adds it to the expression.
        Parameters:
        coefficient - the coefficient of the equation (5x -- (5) is the coefficient)
        power - the power of the equation (5x^2 -- (2) is the power)

    • Method Detail

      • addTerm

        public void addTerm(Integer coefficient,
                    Integer power)
        AddTerm method allows the user to add a coefficient and power to a given polynomial. First addTerm checks if the polynomial is empty, if it is, it creates a new Polynomial node with the given parameters. If the polynomial is not null the while loop goes through each term checking if its 'next' is null. Once it determines the the next is null it breaks out of the loop and creates a new node with the given parameters in that spot and sets its' next to null.
        Specified by:
        addTerm in interface IPolynomial
        Parameters:
        coefficient - the coefficient to be added to the polynomial
        power - the power the coefficient will be raised to.

      • removeTerm

        public void removeTerm(Integer power)
        removeTerm method gives the user the ability to remove any, and all coefficients with that specific power.
        Specified by:
        removeTerm in interface IPolynomial
        Parameters:
        power - the power (exponent) that is used to search for the coefficient we want to remove

      • getDegree

        public Integer getDegree()
        Gets the highest degree of the polynomial by checking each nodes power.
        Specified by:
        getDegree in interface IPolynomial
        Returns:
        the highest degree of the polynomial, represented as an Integer.

      • getCoefficient

        public Integer getCoefficient(Integer power)
        Gets the coefficient that has the specific power Integer attached to it.
        Specified by:
        getCoefficient in interface IPolynomial
        Parameters:
        power - the degree that a coefficient is raised to
        Returns:
        a coefficient

      • isSame

        public Boolean isSame(IPolynomial obj)
        Takes another polynomial object and returns true to check if they are the same. Two polynomials are the same if they contain the same terms.
        Specified by:
        isSame in interface IPolynomial
        Parameters:
        obj - a polynomial
        Returns:
        true or false

      • isEmpty

        public Boolean isEmpty()
        Method checks to see if the polynomial expression is empty. If it is, then the node inside will be null (true). Otherwise, the node will contain a node not equal to null and be evaluated as false.
        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface IPolynomial
        Returns:
        true or false

      • evaluate

        public Double evaluate(Double number)
        Method evaluates the polynomial by interchanging the variables with the inputted Double.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface IPolynomial
        Parameters:
        number - the number to interchange the variables with.
        Returns:
        the result of the polynomial, when using the specific number
